ADVENTURE.DocumentAdd: This Document will be added when the Adventure is built.
ADVENTURE.DocumentMissing: This Document is missing from the World and will not be updated when the Adventure is built.
ADVENTURE.DocumentRemove: This Document will be removed when the Adventure is built.
ADVENTURE.DocumentUpdate: This Document will be updated when the Adventure is built.
ADVENTURE.ExportDropZone: Drag and drop content from your World to populate content into the Adventure.
ADVENTURE.ExportPackNoSystem: You are attempting to export Actors or Items into an Adventure that is system agnostic. The Adventure compendium must have a system field that matches the system that these Actors or Items are from.
ADVENTURE.ExportPrimaryDocumentsOnly: You may only add primary Documents that exist within the World.
ADVENTURE.FIELDS.caption.hint: Provide a text caption that will be displayed beneath the banner image. This caption may contain HTML or plain text.

ADVENTURE.FIELDS.description.hint: Provide a description containing an overview and synopsis of the adventure.
ADVENTURE.FIELDS.description.label: Adventure Description

ADVENTURE.FIELDS.img.label: Banner Image
ADVENTURE.FIELDS.name.hint: Choose a name for this adventure that will be unique within the package that contains it.
ADVENTURE.FIELDS.name.label: Adventure Name
ADVENTURE.ImportOverwriteWarning: Some content from the {name} adventure already exists in your World. If you import the adventure that content will be overwritten. Do you want to proceed?
APPLICATION.IMAGE_POPOUT.AltText: A featured image: the subject is not known.
BEHAVIOR.TYPES.modifyMovementCost.FIELDS: Configure the movement cost multiplier for each movement action. Overlapping movement cost modifications stack multiplicatively.

CARD.PlayHint: Play this card by passing it to some other hand or pile.
CARDS.DealHint: Choose a set of hands or piles to which cards will be dealt. The same number of cards are dealt to all selected hands/piles.
CARDS.DealWarnNoTargets: You must create a hand or pile to deal cards to.
CARDS.DeleteCannotHint: The following decks still have cards drawn and cannot be deleted, please reset them first: {decks}
CARDS.DeleteMustReset: This {type} must be reset before it can be deleted, would you like to proceed?
CARDS.DrawHint: Choose a deck from which to draw a certain number of cards.
CARDS.DrawWarnNoSources: There are no decks available which you can draw from.
CARDS.FIELDS.img.label: Default Back Image
CARDS.FIELDS.type.label: Card Stack Type
CARDS.PassHint: Pass some number of cards to another hand or pile.
CARDS.PassWarnNoTargets: There are no hands or piles available which you can pass to.
CARDS.ResetConfirm: Are you sure you want to reset {name}? All dealt cards will be recalled.
CARDS.ReturnConfirm: Are you sure? All cards in {name} will be returned to their original decks.
COMBAT.CONFIG.FIELDS.core.combatTrackerC: Choose an attribute to track for each combatant.
Automatically bypass combatants marked as defeated.
The animation type to use by default for each Token turn marker.
Apply a tint to the turn marker based on the Token disposition.
Enable combat turn markers by default for all Tokens.
An image or video file to use by default as a Token turn marker.
COMBAT.FIELDS.round.label: Round
COMBAT.FIELDS.turn.label: Turn
CONTROLS.AutoLightToggleP: Lights can be configured to be active only in certain darkness levels and automatically turn on/off.
CONTROLS.BasicSelectP: Select any Tokens that you own to see their line of sight. When no tokens are selected you'll see what all of the Tokens you own can see.
CONTROLS.ClearAllHint: Permanently delete all {type} objects from this Scene?
CONTROLS.DoorBlocks: Movement, vision, and hearing unless opened
CONTROLS.DrawingPolyP: Click + Drag to start then Click to add points. Double Click to finish.
CONTROLS.EmptyUndoHistory: No more tracked history for {type} objects to undo.
CONTROLS.FOWResetDesc: This will reset fog of war for this Scene for all players.
CONTROLS.HeaderCanvasNotes: These controls apply when interacting with a specific Canvas layer.
CONTROLS.HeaderGameNotes: These controls generally apply across all aspects of Foundry functionality.
CONTROLS.HeaderObjectsNotes: These controls apply when interacting with an Object placed on the Canvas.
CONTROLS.HeaderSpecialNotes: These controls apply only during specific interactions.
CONTROLS.Instructions: This form describes common keyboard and mouse commands used to control various aspects of the Foundry Virtual Tabletop environment. Some controls are only available to a Game Master user, those are highlighted in light purple.
CONTROLS.LightResetP: Resets the explored fog of war for all players in this Scene.
CONTROLS.MakeDayP: Smoothly transition the Scene's Darkness level to 0.
CONTROLS.MakeNightP: Smoothly transition the Scene's Darkness level to 1.
CONTROLS.MeasureConfigHint: Configure the placement and display of the measurement template.
CONTROLS.ObjectConfigured: You cannot take this action while configuring another object.
CONTROLS.ObjectIsLocked: You cannot take this action while the {type} object is locked.
CONTROLS.RegionHoleP: When active, any Shape you draw on a Region using any of the Shape tools will create a Hole where the Region's behaviors will not apply.
CONTROLS.RegionPerformance: Performance Note: Each drawing is its own Shape. Be careful not to place multiple Shapes entirely within each other. Rather than combining simple Shapes to create a complex Shape, consider using the Region Polygon tool.
CONTROLS.RegionSelectP: Select one or more Regions in the Scene. A selected Region is a solid color and unselected Regions are striped.
CONTROLS.RegionShape: Add a Shape to the selected Region. If no Region is selected a new Region will be created. Overlapping Shapes in the same Region will combine. Shapes in the same Region all share the same color.
CONTROLS.RegionSnap: When active, any Shape you draw on a Region using any of the Shape tools will be snapped to the grid.
CONTROLS.SoundPreviewP: When active, hover your cursor over an ambient sound to hear it as if your Token was in that position.
CONTROLS.TargetSelectP: Target any Tokens that you can see.
CONTROLS.Title: Game Controls Reference
CONTROLS.UnconstrainedMovementP: When active, you can move Tokens through Walls and impassible terrain.
CONTROLS.WallSecretHiddenP: Secret Doors can't be seen by players
CONTROLS.WallSnapP: Wall points snap to nearest grid vertex when active
CONTROLS.WallTerrainBlocks: Sight beyond the second wall, movement, and hearing
CONTROLS.WallWindowBlocks: Sight, movement, and hearing beyond a certain distance

ELEMENTS.TAGS.ErrorBlank: Tags in an HTMLStringTagsElement may not be blank.
ERROR.BackgroundTextureSize: You are using a Scene background texture with dimensions {width}px by {height}px. One or both of these dimensions exceeds the maximum texture size of {max}px supported by your device.
ERROR.BrowserVersion: Foundry Virtual Tabletop uses modern JavaScript features which are unsupported on {browser} version less than {minimum}. You are using {browser} version {version}. Please update or use a different browser.
ERROR.CantWhisper: You do not have permission to send whispered chat messages to other users.
ERROR.ElectronVersion: You are using an older version of the Foundry Virtual Tabletop Electron client. For best performance we recommend that you re-download your desired version of Foundry Virtual Tabletop and perform a full re-installation of the software.
ERROR.InvalidAdminKey: The provided server administrator password is invalid. If you have forgotten your configured password you will need to manually delete the Config/admin.txt file from your user data location.
ERROR.LoadPackages: The request to browse existing packages failed to connect with the Foundry server. Make sure your application allows outbound connections.
ERROR.NoHardwareAcceleration: Your web browser does not have hardware acceleration enabled. This will severely impair the performance of Foundry Virtual Tabletop and cause graphical errors and anomalies. Be sure to enable hardware acceleration in your browser settings.
ERROR.NoTargetUsersForWhisper: No target users exist for this whisper. Check your spelling or try "/w [User Name]" instead.
ERROR.NoWebGL: Your browser does not currently support WebGL rendering which is required by Foundry Virtual Tabletop. Ensure that you have hardware rendering and WebGL enabled in your browser.
ERROR.NoWebGL2: Your browser does not currently support WebGL Version 2 rendering which is essential for Foundry Virtual Tabletop to work properly. Errors or abnormal graphical behavior may occur.
ERROR.RESOLUTION.Scale: Foundry Virtual Tabletop requires a usable window dimensions of {reqWidth}px by {reqHeight}px or greater. The current dimensions of this window are {curWidth}px by {curHeight}px. You currently have a zoom factor applied either at the operating system or browser level, which is reducing the effective size of your window. You must enlarge the size of your window or reduce the zoom factor applied to your browser, or else some features of the software will not work properly.
ERROR.RESOLUTION.Screen: Foundry Virtual Tabletop requires a screen resolution of {reqWidth}px by {reqHeight}px or greater. Your display has a resolution of {curWidth}px by {curHeight}px. You must increase your resolution or use a different display device, or else some features of the software will not work properly.
ERROR.RESOLUTION.Window: Foundry Virtual Tabletop requires usable window dimensions of {reqWidth}px by {reqHeight}px or greater. The current dimensions of this window are {curWidth}px by {curHeight}px. You must enlarge the size of your window, or else some features of the software will not work properly.
ERROR.RendererNotDetected: Your GPU renderer was unable to be identified, unexpected performance issues may occur.
ERROR.RequiresElectronReinstall: Foundry Virtual Tabletop Version {version} is now available but cannot be installed from within the Foundry Virtual Tabletop application because it includes a new Electron version which can only be installed manually by re-installing the software from the foundryvtt.com website.
ERROR.RequiresFullReinstall: Foundry Virtual Tabletop Version {version} is now available but cannot be installed from within the Foundry Virtual Tabletop application because it requires updates to core dependencies which are only available by re-installing the software from the foundryvtt.com website.
ERROR.RequiresGenerationReinstall: Foundry Virtual Tabletop Version {version} is now available but cannot be installed from within the Foundry Virtual Tabletop application because it is a new generation update which must be installed manually by re-installing the software from the foundryvtt.com website.
FILES.CannotUpload: Uploads to this directory are not permitted.

FILES.ErrorSomethingWrong: Something went wrong with your file upload request.
FILES.ErrorTooLarge: The file you have attempted to upload is too large for your proxy server to handle.
FILES.NoResults: No matching results found in this location.
FILES.TileSizeHint: Specify the pixel grid size of source tile artwork so it will be automatically resized when placed onto your active Scene.
FILES.WarnUploadModules: You have uploaded files into a module or system directory. This is generally unsafe because updates to the system or module will delete your files.

PACKAGE.Compatibility.Label: Compatibility

PACKAGE.FIELDS.description.hint: A plain text or HTML description that explains the purpose and contents of this package.
PACKAGE.FIELDS.description.label: Package Description
PACKAGE.FIELDS.id.hint: The identifier must be a unique alphanumeric string with no special characters other than hyphens.
PACKAGE.FIELDS.id.label: Package Identifier
PACKAGE.FIELDS.packs.element.label.label: Label
PACKAGE.FIELDS.packs.element.name.disabl: You cannot change this compendium pack name because it already exists.
PACKAGE.FIELDS.packs.element.name.hint: A unique alphanumeric string with no special characters that identifies the compendium pack.
PACKAGE.FIELDS.packs.element.name.label: NamN
PACKAGE.FIELDS.packs.element.system.hint: Actor, Item, or Adventure compendium packs (which contain Actors or Items) must declare which specific game system they are designed for.

PACKAGE.FIELDS.title.hint: The title is human readable and may contain special characters.
PACKAGE.FIELDS.title.label: Package Title
PACKAGE.FIELDS.url.hint: A website URL where more details about this package can be discovered.
PACKAGE.FIELDS.url.label: Package URL
PACKAGE.FIELDS.version.hint: The version field identifies a specific iteration of this package. Supported version schemes allow for strings or numbers separated by periods.
PACKAGE.FIELDS.version.label: Package Version
PACKAGE.InstallFailed: Errors were encountered while installing the package. Consult your console log (F12) for details.
PACKAGE.LaunchLocked: You may not launch the World "{id}" because it is locked.
PACKAGE.ModuleCreateErrorAlreadyExists: The Module "{id}" already exists! Choose a different package identifier.
PACKAGE.ModuleCreateHint: You can use this form to create a Module which can be shared across multiple Worlds or packaged for distribution to other users. This form supports a subset of possible package configuration. You will be able to further manage and edit your package after creating it by modifying its JSON manifest file.
PACKAGE.ModuleCreateSuccess: Created new Module "{id}", which is now available to use!
PACKAGE.ModuleEditHint: You can use this form to update properties of your Module manifest data.
PACKAGE.ModuleEditWarning: You are editing package manifest data for an installable module. Changes made to this data have the possibility to break functionality or ability of the module to be further updated. Please proceed with caution.
PACKAGE.UninstallLocked: You may not uninstall the {type} "{id}" because it is locked.
PACKAGE.UpdateAllInProgress: An "update all" workflow is already in progress. You must wait for it to complete before updating other package types.
PERMISSION.QueryUserHint: Allow users with this role to query other users.

SCENE.BackgroundScaleHint: Use SHIFT+Mousewheel or SHIFT+Up Arrow and SHIFT+Down Arrow to adjust the background image size.
SCENE.CaptureInitialViewPosition: Captured canvas position as initial view in the Scene configuration form.
SCENE.DimensionChangeWarning: You are changing the underlying dimensions of this Scene, if you have already placed objects in this Scene this operation may cause those objects to shift position relative to the background image.
SCENE.DimensionLinked: Scene dimensions are currently linked: changing one will change the other to maintain aspect ratio. Click to unlink.
SCENE.DimensionUnlinked: Scene dimensions are currently unlinked, changing one will not change the other. Click to link.
SCENE.DimensionsHint: The scene dimensions are automatically set to match the background image's dimensions when a background image is first configured.
SCENE.DistortedDimensionsWarning: You have chosen new dimensions that are of a different aspect ratio than the original. Do you wish to automatically reposition placed objects such as Tokens? The result may end up appearing distorted.
SCENE.FIELDS.background.offsetX.label: Horizontal
SCENE.FIELDS.background.offsetY.label: Vertical
SCENE.FIELDS.background.src.hint: Configure the background image and dimensions of the scene's primary map.
SCENE.FIELDS.background.src.label: Background Image
SCENE.FIELDS.backgroundColor.label: Background Color
SCENE.FIELDS.environment.base.hue.hint: Choose a hue (color) to blend into the entire scene. To activate the color slider, you must have an intensity greater than 0.
SCENE.FIELDS.environment.base.hue.label: Hue
Adjust how intensely the chosen hue is blended into the scene. A high hue intensity saturates the scene with the color, possibly overwhelming existing colors. A lower hue intensity blends in the chosen color more subtly.
SCENE.FIELDS.environment.base.luminosity: Control how bright the scene appears. Higher luminosity makes the scene bright like a sunny day, while lower luminosity makes it appear darker and gloomier.
SCENE.FIELDS.environment.base.saturation: Adjust the purity of colors in the scene. Settings above 0 make the colors more saturated (intense and vibrant) while negative settings dull and mute the colors.
SCENE.FIELDS.environment.base.shadows.hi: Raising this slider causes the shadows and darker elements of the scene to be darker and deeper.
SCENE.FIELDS.environment.cycle.hint: When this option is checked, the base ambience values are merged with the darkness ambience values according to darkness level.
SCENE.FIELDS.environment.cycle.label: Blend Ambience
SCENE.FIELDS.environment.darknessLevel.h: Apply an overlay that darkens the Scene and diminishes light sources to simulate nighttime or dimly illuminated conditions.
SCENE.FIELDS.environment.darknessLock.hi: When this option is checked, the darkness level can't be changed.
SCENE.FIELDS.environment.globalLight.dar: A darkness threshold between 0 and 1. When the Scene darkness level exceeds this threshold Global Illumination is automatically disabled.
SCENE.FIELDS.environment.globalLight.ena: This Scene contains a global source of light that provides all areas of the Scene with a base level of illumination.
SCENE.FIELDS.fog.colors.explored.hint: A color applied to all areas of the Scene which have been explored but are outside of the current vision area.
SCENE.FIELDS.fog.colors.explored.label: Fog Explored Color
SCENE.FIELDS.fog.colors.unexplored.hint: A solid color applied to all unexplored areas of the Scene.
SCENE.FIELDS.fog.colors.unexplored.label: Fog Unexplored Color
SCENE.FIELDS.fog.exploration.hint: If this setting is enabled, fog-of-war exploration will be tracked on a per-User basis and stored to the database as the Scene is explored. Otherwise, fog exploration does not occur and instead Tokens are limited to only what they can currently see.
SCENE.FIELDS.fog.exploration.label: Fog Exploration
SCENE.FIELDS.fog.overlay.hint: An optional fog of war image to be drawn above unexplored parts of the scene.
SCENE.FIELDS.fog.overlay.label: Fog of War Image
SCENE.FIELDS.foreground.hint: An optional foreground image which is drawn above other objects in the Scene.
SCENE.FIELDS.foreground.label: Foreground Image
SCENE.FIELDS.foregroundElevation.hint: An elevation in distance units which configures the height of the foreground image and overhead tiles.
SCENE.FIELDS.foregroundElevation.label: Foreground Elevation
SCENE.FIELDS.grid.alpha.label: Grid Opacity
SCENE.FIELDS.grid.color.label: Grid Color
SCENE.FIELDS.grid.distance.label: Distance
SCENE.FIELDS.grid.size.hint: The pixel size of a single grid space. Use the Grid Configuration tool to visually adjust this.
SCENE.FIELDS.grid.size.label: Grid Size
SCENE.FIELDS.grid.style.label: Grid Style
SCENE.FIELDS.grid.thickness.label: Grid Thickness
SCENE.FIELDS.grid.type.label: Grid Type
SCENE.FIELDS.grid.units.label: Units
SCENE.FIELDS.initial.scale.label: Zoom
SCENE.FIELDS.journal.hint: A linked Journal Entry providing notes for the Game Master about this Scene.
SCENE.FIELDS.journal.label: Journal Entry
SCENE.FIELDS.journalEntryPage.hint: A specific page from the linked Journal Entry.
SCENE.FIELDS.journalEntryPage.label: Journal Entry Page
SCENE.FIELDS.name.label: Scene Name
SCENE.FIELDS.navName.hint: An alternative name for the Scene that is displayed in the Navigation Bar instead of the actual Scene name.
SCENE.FIELDS.navName.label: Navigation Name
SCENE.FIELDS.navigation.label: Show in Navigation
SCENE.FIELDS.padding.hint: An amount of additional padding around the Scene background image which provides usable canvas space.
SCENE.FIELDS.padding.label: Padding Percentage
SCENE.FIELDS.playlist.hint: A Playlist that should automatically begin playing when this Scene is activated.
SCENE.FIELDS.playlist.label: Scene Playlist
SCENE.FIELDS.playlistSound.hint: A specific Sound within the Audio Playlist, which should play when this Scene is active.
SCENE.FIELDS.playlistSound.label: Playlist Sound
SCENE.FIELDS.tokenVision.hint: Restrict visibility within this Scene to the vision of controlled Tokens. If disabled, the entire Scene is visible.
SCENE.FIELDS.tokenVision.label: Token Vision
SCENE.FIELDS.weather.hint: Display an active Weather Effect which is present within this Scene.
SCENE.FIELDS.weather.label: Weather Effect
SCENE.GenerateThumbNoCanvas: Scene thumbnail cannot be generated with 'Disable Game Canvas' setting active.
SCENE.GenerateThumbUploadDenied: The scene thumbnail could not be generated because the user does not have permission to upload files.
SCENE.GridConfigToolHint: Configure the grid and background image position using the mousewheel and arrow keys, or by manually setting the following fields.
SCENE.GridPositionHint: Use the Arrow Keys to shift the background image offset.
SCENE.GridResizeHint: Use ALT+Mousewheel or ALT+Up Arrow and ALT+Down Arrow to adjust the grid size.
SCENE.GridSizeError: This resize would reduce the grid size under the minimum of 50px. If you would like to reduce to this size, please swap to gridless first and resetup a new grid after resize.
SCENE.InitialViewHint: Set a default camera position that is displayed the first time this Scene is viewed.
SCENE.InvalidDimension: The dimension provided would result in a non-integer value for the other dimension. Please try a different value or unlink the dimensions.
SCENE_NAVIGATION.LABEL: Scene Navigation
SERVER_SETTINGS.FIELDS.adminPassword.hin: An administrator password is used to protect access to this Setup and Configuration area of Foundry Virtual Tabletop. It is strongly encouraged to set an administrator password for your server.
SERVER_SETTINGS.FIELDS.awsConfig.hint: You may provide an AWS configuration file for S3 integration. The path is absolute or relative to the Config subdirectory of user data.
SERVER_SETTINGS.FIELDS.awsConfig.label: AWS Configuration Path
SERVER_SETTINGS.FIELDS.compressSocket.hi: Enable compression of data sent from the server to the client via websocket. This is recommended for network performance.
SERVER_SETTINGS.FIELDS.compressStatic.hi: Compress files served by the Foundry Virtual Tabletop web server before sending them to the client to reduce the amount of data transferred.
SERVER_SETTINGS.FIELDS.cssTheme.hint: Choose from several visual themes which configure the appearance of the application setup menu.
SERVER_SETTINGS.FIELDS.cssTheme.label: Setup Theme
SERVER_SETTINGS.FIELDS.dataPath.hint: Configure the location where your user data including worlds, systems and modules are stored.
SERVER_SETTINGS.FIELDS.dataPath.label: User Data Path
SERVER_SETTINGS.FIELDS.deleteNEDB.hint: In version 11, our software moved from an old database technology (NEDB) to a new one (LevelDB). We automatically migrate your old database files into the new format and retain the old NEDB files just in case you need to roll back or diagnose some issue. This safety measure increases the amount of space that Foundry Virtual Tabletop consumes on your hard drive. Enabling this feature will automatically delete NEDB files after they have been migrated. This will become the default behavior in Version 12.
SERVER_SETTINGS.FIELDS.deleteNEDB.label: Delete Migrated NEDB Files
SERVER_SETTINGS.FIELDS.fullscreen.hint: Open the application in a full-screen view, without toolbars or other user-interface elements.
SERVER_SETTINGS.FIELDS.fullscreen.label: Full-Screen Mode
SERVER_SETTINGS.FIELDS.hotReload.hint: Allow Packages to hot reload certain assets,such as CSS, HTML, and Localization files without a full refresh. This setting is only recommended for developers.
SERVER_SETTINGS.FIELDS.hotReload.label: Hot-Reload Package Files
SERVER_SETTINGS.FIELDS.language.hint: You may choose a default language for the application by choosing a module which provides the core translation files for that language.
SERVER_SETTINGS.FIELDS.language.label: Default Language
SERVER_SETTINGS.FIELDS.port.hint: Choose which port Foundry Virtual Tabletop uses for TCP connection traffic and enable or disable Universal Plug and Play (UPnP).
SERVER_SETTINGS.FIELDS.port.label: Port
SERVER_SETTINGS.FIELDS.sslCert.hint: You may run the server using secure socket layer (SSL) encryption by providing paths to certificate and key files. Paths are absolute or relative to the Config subdirectory in user data.
SERVER_SETTINGS.FIELDS.sslCert.label: Certificate
SERVER_SETTINGS.FIELDS.sslKey.label: Key
SERVER_SETTINGS.FIELDS.telemetry.hint: Allow sharing usage data with us that helps us to improve Foundry Virtual Tabletop. The data collected if this option is enabled is documented in our Privacy Policy and does not contain any personally identifying information and is not shared with any other party. Sharing usage data helps us to answer questions like "which Foundry Virtual Tabletop software versions are most heavily used", "which Game Systems are most played", and "which Module versions are frequently installed". We use insights from this data to help us improve software compatibility, provide better customer support, and share aggregate insights with our community. If this option is disabled, no data will be shared.
SERVER_SETTINGS.FIELDS.telemetry.label: Allow Sharing Usage Data
SERVER_SETTINGS.FIELDS.upnp.label: Enable UPnP
SERVER_SETTINGS.FIELDS.world.hint: You may choose one of your available worlds to automatically launch when the software is started.
SERVER_SETTINGS.FIELDS.world.label: Default World
SERVER_SETTINGS.Save.label: Save Application Configuration
SERVER_SETTINGS.Save.restart: Foundry Virtual Tabletop application configuration settings have been changed. You must restart your server for the changes to take effect.
SERVER_SETTINGS.Save.warning: Modifying these configuration options will require you to restart your server in order for them to take effect. Do you wish to continue?
SERVER_SETTINGS.Telemetry.request1: If you provide your permission, Foundry Virtual Tabletop will share a small amount of anonymous usage data with the foundryvtt.com website that allows our team to better understand how Foundry VTT is being used and helps us to improve the software.
SERVER_SETTINGS.Telemetry.request2: This prompt will only be displayed once, you can change your preferences regarding sharing usage data at any time in the Application Configuration menu by clicking the icon at the top-right of this screen.
SERVER_SETTINGS.Title: Application Configuration
SERVER_SETTINGS.Warning: These fields customize the behavior of the Foundry Virtual Tabletop application. Changes will require the server to restart.
SETTINGS.PrototypeTokenOverrides.Hint: Configure overrides of Prototype Token data for all Actors.
SETTINGS.PrototypeTokenOverrides.Label: Configure Prototype Overrides
SETTINGS.PrototypeTokenOverrides.Name: Prototype Token Overrides
SETTINGS.PrototypeTokenOverrides.Reset.W: This action will remove all configured overrides.
SETTINGS.PrototypeTokenOverrides.TABS.Al: These overrides apply to all Prototype Tokens, regardless of parent Actor type. They can themselves be overridden for each Actor type in the subsequent tabs. A blank selection for a field indicates no override.
SETTINGS.TokenAutoRotateL: When enabled, Tokens are automatically rotated in the direction of movement by default. Regardless of this setting, the Lock Rotation setting on individual tokens will still prevent their artwork from being visually rotated.
SETTINGS.UI.FIELDS.chatNotifications.hin: Choose whether notifications of new chat messages appear as full chat cards, or only as a pip on the chat tab.
SETTINGS.UI.FIELDS.colorScheme.applicati: Specify whether you prefer windowed UI applications like character sheets to render using a light theme or a dark theme. Not all sheets support this preference.
SETTINGS.UI.FIELDS.colorScheme.interface: Specify whether you prefer user interface elements to render using a light theme or a dark theme.
SETTINGS.UI.FIELDS.fade.opacity.hint: The opacity of faded user interface elements when they are not active. Lower values are more transparent.
SETTINGS.UI.FIELDS.fade.opacity.label: Inactive Opacity
SETTINGS.UI.FIELDS.fade.speed.hint: How quickly interface elements fade in or out when the mouse enters or departs their area. Lower values are faster.
SETTINGS.UI.FIELDS.fade.speed.label: Fade Speed
SETTINGS.UI.FIELDS.fontScale.hint: Enlarge or reduce the default font size used in the application.
SETTINGS.UI.FIELDS.fontScale.label: Font Size
SETTINGS.UI.FIELDS.uiScale.hint: Apply a global scaling factor to the overall user interface to make it larger or smaller.
SETTINGS.UI.FIELDS.uiScale.label: Interface Scale
SETTINGS.UI.MENU.hint: Settings which affect how the Foundry Virtual Tabletop user interface appears or behaves.
SETTINGS.UI.MENU.label: Configure Interface
SETTINGS.UI.MENU.name: User Interface Configuration
SETUP.AdminPasswordForgot: If you have forgotten the administrator password, the server administrator can reset it by following these instructions.
SETUP.AdminPasswordPrompt: There is not currently an active game on this server. In order to access the setup menu you must provide the server administrator password.
SETUP.BACKUPS.CannotDeleteInSnapshot: Backups that are part of snapshots cannot be individually deleted.
SETUP.BACKUPS.CannotRestoreUnusable: This backup cannot be restored as it would render the package unusable.
SETUP.BACKUPS.CreateBackupFailure: Failed to create backup for package '{title}'. See the console (F12) for details.
SETUP.BACKUPS.CreateSnapshotConfirm: This process can take a long time depending on the number packages, their sizes, and the storage medium, and the process cannot be interrupted. Do you want to continue?
SETUP.BACKUPS.CreateSnapshotFailure: Failed to create snapshot. See the console (F12) for details.
SETUP.BACKUPS.CreateSnapshotHint: Creating a snapshot will take backups of every currently installed package, allowing you to later rollback the state of your Foundry VTT installation to the point when the snapshot was taken.
SETUP.BACKUPS.CreateSnapshotPackageList: The following packages will be included in this snapshot:
SETUP.BACKUPS.DeleteBackupFailure: Failed to delete backups for package '{title}'. See the console (F12) for details.
SETUP.BACKUPS.DeleteBackupWarning: Deleting a backup cannot be reversed. Do you want to continue?
SETUP.BACKUPS.DeleteBackupWarningPl: {count} backups have been selected for deletion. This action cannot be reversed. Do you want to continue?
SETUP.BACKUPS.DeleteSnapshotFailure: Failed to delete one or more snapshots. See the console (F12) for details.
SETUP.BACKUPS.DeleteSnapshotWarning: Deleting a snapshot cannot be reversed. Do you want to continue?
SETUP.BACKUPS.DeleteSnapshotWarningPl: {count} snapshots have been selected for deletion. This action cannot be reversed. Do you want to continue?
SETUP.BACKUPS.LargePackageWarning: The chosen package appears to be quite large. It may remain at 0% for some time before the backup process can begin. Please be patient.
SETUP.BACKUPS.NoteHint: Optionally provide a note for reference.
SETUP.BACKUPS.RestoreBackupComplete: Successfully restored {title} with backup taken on {date}
SETUP.BACKUPS.RestoreBackupFailure: Failed to restore backup for {title}. See the console (F12) for details.
SETUP.BACKUPS.RestoreBackupWarning: Restoring a backup will erase the current state of the package. This action cannot be reversed. Do you want to continue?
SETUP.BACKUPS.RestoreSnapshotFailure: Failed to restore snapshot. See the console (F12) for details.
SETUP.BACKUPS.RestoreSnapshotUnchangedPa: 1 package was added after the snapshot was taken and will remain unchanged after the snapshot is restored.
{count} packages were added after the snapshot was taken and will remain unchanged after the snapshot is restored.
SETUP.BACKUPS.RestoreSnapshotWarning: Restoring a snapshot resets the state of your Foundry VTT installation back to the state at which the snapshot was taken. All versions and world states will be rolled back. This process cannot be undone.
SETUP.COMPAT.COMPATIBLE.Latest: The latest version of this package is compatible with the {version} update
SETUP.COMPAT.COMPATIBLE.World: This world's system has a compatible version available for the {version} update
SETUP.COMPAT.CompatibleTooltip: Packages that are verified as compatible with version {version}.
SETUP.COMPAT.INCOMPATIBLE.Latest: The latest version of this package is not compatible with the {version} update
SETUP.COMPAT.INCOMPATIBLE.World: There is no compatible version of this world's system available for the {version} update
SETUP.COMPAT.IncompatibleTooltip: Packages that are verified as incompatible with version {version}.
SETUP.COMPAT.RISK.Latest: The latest version of this package was last verified for core software version {verified}
SETUP.COMPAT.RISK.World: This world's system was last verified for core software version {verified}
SETUP.COMPAT.Title: Preview Compatibility: {release}
SETUP.COMPAT.UnverifiedTooltip: Packages that were last verified as compatible with an earlier build and are likely still compatible with version {version}.
SETUP.COMPAT.WarningTooltip: Packages that were last verified as compatible with an earlier generation and may not be compatible with version {version}.
SETUP.CompatibilityRequireDowngrade: This dependency is newer than the minimum required version {version}
SETUP.CompatibilityRequireUpgrade: This dependency is older than the minimum required version {version}
SETUP.CompatibilityRiskUnknown: Compatibility Risk: no compatibility data specified
SETUP.CompatibilityRiskWithVersion: Compatibility Risk: last verified for version {version}
SETUP.CoreUpdateInstructions: An update to the Core Software is available, Return to Setup in order to apply it!
SETUP.CoreVersionHint: If an update to the core Foundry Virtual Tabletop software is available, you may apply it here. You are currently using {versionDisplay}.
SETUP.ErrorTimeout: The request to {url} timed out after {timeout}s
SETUP.ForceUpdateHint: Selecting the Force Update option will overwrite your current software by resetting it back to the latest version on your requested update channel. Use this option with caution.
SETUP.INSTALL_PACKAGE.ManifestIncompatib: The {packageType} at the provided URL is not compatible with the current version of Foundry Virtual Tabletop.
Are you sure you wish to proceed with the installation?
SETUP.INSTALL_PACKAGE.ManifestWrongPacka: The provided URL does not appear to point to a {packageType}.
SETUP.InstallFailure: Installation Failed: {message}. See the Console (F12) for more details
SETUP.InstallHint: You can install any package by providing a direct link to its Manifest URL.
SETUP.LockHint: Locking a Package prevents it from being uninstalled or updated
SETUP.ManifestUpdate: Updated version available at new installation URL
SETUP.ManifestUpdateAvailable: A newer version of "{package}" is available at a different installation URL. This happens when the package hosting location or the author has changed.
SETUP.MinifyFilesHint: Reduce network traffic by serving minified static JavaScript and CSS files. Enabling this setting is recommended for most users, but module developers may wish to disable it.
SETUP.NoFeaturedContent: No content recommendations were received from the foundryvtt.com web server.
SETUP.NoSystemsMessage: In order to create your first World, you must first install a Game System. Please take some time to browse available systems and choose one to install. If you do not know which system you want, or your preferred system is unavailable, we recommend that you install the Simple Worldbuilding system.
SETUP.NoWorldsMessage: Now that you have a Game System providing you rules on how to play, you'll want to create a World. Game worlds are spaces that contain all of the characters, sheets, journals and maps used to play a game, whether it's a one-shot or a full campaign.
SETUP.NueWorldDescription: For more info on setting up Worlds, check out the World documentation.
SETUP.PackageDeleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete the {type} "{title}"?
SETUP.PackageDeletePersistent: This package has stored persistent files, often used for things like configuration or cached data. This data will be deleted if you proceed.
SETUP.PackageDeleteWorldConfirm: You must enter the exact code to confirm the deletion request.
SETUP.PackageDependenciesCouldInstallSin: A dependency can be automatically installed.
SETUP.PackageDependenciesCouldNotInstall: {number} dependencies need to be manually installed.
A dependency needs to be manually installed.
SETUP.PackageDependenciesDecline: You have chosen not to install the required dependency packages for {title}. You will need to install them manually.
SETUP.PackageHasDependenciesSingular: {title} has a dependency which is not yet installed.
SETUP.PackageIncompatibleSystemsBulkProm: The following modules were not updated because doing so would have made them incompatible with one or more installed systems. Do you want to update them regardless?
SETUP.PackageIncompatibleSystemsPrompt: This module update is incompatible with the following installed systems, do you want to continue?
SETUP.PackageInstallDependencies: Do you wish to install these automatically?
SETUP.PackageOptionalDependencies: These dependencies are optional, but may enhance the functionality of the package if installed:
SETUP.PackageRequiredDependencies: These dependencies are required, and the package will not function without them:
SETUP.PackageRequiresDowngradeHint: You must downgrade to Foundry VTT version {vmax} in order to install this package.
SETUP.PackageRequiresUpgradeHint: You must upgrade to Foundry VTT version {vmin} in order to install this package.
SETUP.PackageUpdateCoreInsufficient: An update for {title} is available but it requires an older core software version {vmax} to function. You are currently using version {vcur}.
SETUP.PackageUpdateCoreUnstable: An update is available for {title} but it may not be installed because it requires a core software version {vmin} which is not yet stable.
SETUP.PackageUpdateCoreUpdateNeeded: An update is available for {title} but cannot be installed because it requires the core software to be updated to at least {vmin}. You are currently using version {vcur}.
SETUP.PackagesNoResults: No installed {type} matched your search for "{name}".
SETUP.RecommendedPackageNote: This dependency is recommended as it enhances the package's functionality.
SETUP.ReinstallPackageNotFound: Package reinstallation failed as a package with that ID could not be found at the central package repository. You will need to manually reinstall it via its manifest link.
SETUP.RequiredPackageNote: This dependency is required for the package to function.
SETUP.SeeTutorial: For a more in-depth guide to getting started with Foundry Virtual Tabletop, you can reference the Gamemaster Tutorial series in our Knowledge Base.
SETUP.SwapToTheUpdatedManifest: Would you like to switch to the new manifest URL? (this is recommended)
SETUP.SystemUpdateInstructions: An update to the System is available, Return to Setup in order to apply it!
SETUP.Title: Configuration and Setup
SETUP.UPDATE_NOTES.FullList: See the full list of Release Notes.
SETUP.UPDATE_NOTES.NewGenerationHint: Consider taking a snapshot of all installed packages before updating in case you need to roll-back.
SETUP.UPDATE_NOTES.PreviewCompatibilityH: Using the 'preview compatibility' button below, you can check if all your Worlds, Systems, and Modules are supported in Foundry Virtual Tabletop Version {version}.
SETUP.UPDATE_NOTES.Title: Release Notes: {release}
SETUP.UpdateAvailable: An update to {channel} version {version} is now available!
SETUP.UpdateChannelHint: You may choose an update channel to control the types of updates you wish to receive for the core Foundry Virtual Tabletop software. If you do not have a specific reason to change this, it is recommended to consume the Stable channel.
SETUP.UpdateCompleteAuto: Update completed successfully. Restarting Foundry VTT application.
SETUP.UpdateCompleteManual: Update completed successfully. Shutting down Foundry Virtual Tabletop server for manual restart.
SETUP.UpdateDevelopmentHint: API Development: Releases for testing the design of new features and API changes to obtain feedback from the developer community.
SETUP.UpdateHint: You may update your Foundry Virtual Tabletop software to a new version by checking for update on your preferred Software Update Channel.
SETUP.UpdateInfoAvailable: An update to Foundry Virtual Tabletop {display} is available!
SETUP.UpdateLicenseInvalid: Your Foundry Virtual Tabletop license key is not valid.
SETUP.UpdateNoArchive: No update archive exists to install
SETUP.UpdateNoInternetError: Foundry Virtual Tabletop requires an active internet connection to update.
SETUP.UpdateNoUpdateMode: You are not allowed to update this instance of Foundry Virtual Tabletop because it was launched in --noupdate mode.
SETUP.UpdateNotAvailable: No software update is currently available on the requested update channel.
SETUP.UpdatePrototypeHint: Prototype: Releases for previewing the design of experimental features which are not yet fully developed.
SETUP.UpdateStableHint: Stable: Releases that have been carefully tested and are recommended for use in live games.
SETUP.UpdateTestingHint: Feature Testing: Releases for testing the functionality of new features to obtain feedback from the general user community.
SETUP.UpdateWarningWillDisable: This update is a new major version of the Foundry Virtual Tabletop software. Installing this update will require some installed modules which may not yet be compatible to be disabled.
SETUP.UpdateWebsiteSlowWarning: https://foundryvtt.com appears to be under heavy load at this time, we recommend you try again later.
SETUP.UpdateWebsiteUnreachableError: We cannot reach https://foundryvtt.com at this time, please try again later.
SETUP.Verified: Package is verified for this version of Foundry
SETUP.WorldCoreMigrationRequired: Launching the World {world} will migrate its data model from an older core software version ({oldVersion}) to the currently installed {newVersion}.
SETUP.WorldDeleteConfirmCode: Type this exact code in the box below to proceed:
SETUP.WorldDeleteConfirmWarning: This will permanently delete your World and its content and cannot be un-done. Are you sure you wish to do this?
SETUP.WorldLaunchFailure: World launch failed: {message}. See the console (F12) for more details.
SETUP.WorldMigrationBackupPrompt: It is not possible to reverse this process. It is recommended to back up your World data before proceeding. You will need a backup in order to restore to the prior version.
SETUP.WorldMigrationDisableModules: Be sure to update your game system and installed modules before migrating your World. As part of this migration to a new software generation all modules and active scenes will be disabled and any playing audio will be stopped. You may re-enable these modules after the migration is complete.
SETUP.WorldMigrationInProcess: Your World data is being migrated to be compatible with {version}. This may take some time. Please remain patient and do not close the software.
SETUP.WorldMigrationSystemUnavailable: The installed version of the {system} ({systemVersion}) game system is not verified as compatible with this software version. Successful migration cannot be guaranteed.
SETUP.WorldSystemMigrationRequired: This World was last launched with an older system version ({oldVersion}) than the currently installed system version {newVersion} and may require a system migration.
SETUP.YouMustInstallASystem: You must install a game System before you can create a new World
SHEETS.ThemeHint: Not all themes are available for each sheet.
SUPPORT.BugReporting: If you would like to report a bug, please use the Bug Report category available on our Contact Us page.
SUPPORT.Discord: To join others who are using Foundry VTT, or to get support from our wonderful Community Helpers, join our Discord.
SUPPORT.GenerateFullReportHint: A full report contains more detailed information about your installed modules and compendiums and can take some time to generate.
SUPPORT.ModuleSubTypesUnavailableName: {count} {document} are unavailable because the '{name}' module is inactive
SUPPORT.ModuleSubTypesUnavailableNoName: {count} {document} are unavailable because a module with the ID '{name}' is inactive
SUPPORT.ReportPrelude: When asking for help on the Discord or Github, it is helpful for us to know about what is going on in your World. Below is a copy-pastable report we ask that you include.
SUPPORT.Title: Support Details

TOKEN.FIELDS.prependAdjective.hint: Prepend a random adjective to the name of unlinked tokens. For example "Angry Goblin".

TOKEN.FIELDS.sight.attenuation.hint: Adjust the strength of the vision source attenuation (default is 0).
TOKEN.FIELDS.sight.attenuation.label: Attenuation
TOKEN.FIELDS.sight.brightness.hint: Adjust the brightness of this vision source. The greater the brightness, the better the character is able to see in darkness (default is 0).
TOKEN.FIELDS.sight.brightness.label: Vision Brightness
TOKEN.FIELDS.sight.color.label: Vision Color
TOKEN.FIELDS.sight.contrast.hint: Adjust the contrast of the background which is in the vision source radius (default is 0).

TOKEN.FIELDS.sight.enabled.hint: Allows the token to see illuminated spaces within its line of sight.

TOKEN.FIELDS.sight.range.hint: The distance a token can see without any light.

TOKEN.FIELDS.sight.saturation.hint: Adjust the saturation of the background which is in the vision source radius (default is 0).

TOKEN.FIELDS.sight.visionMode.hint: Applies a visual effect to the vision to represent special senses (default is Basic Vision).
TOKEN.FIELDS.sight.visionMode.label: Vision Mode

TOURS.ResetSuccess: Reset the completion status of all tours.
TOURS.ResetWarning: Do you wish to reset all tour progress?
TOURS.SuggestedDescription:
You have completed the {currentTitle} Tour.

We suggest continuing on to the {nextTitle} Tour. Would you like to proceed?

WALL.FIELDS.animation.strength.hint: A multiplier between 0 and 2 that modifies how much the door moves when animating. For example for a swinging door, more strength produces a wider open angle. For a sliding door, more strength causes the door to slide farther.

WALL.FIELDS.threshold.attenuation.hint: The distance that perception can penetrate this wall is adaptive relative to the observer's proximity and the activation threshold. Only applies when a threshold is defined.

WEBRTC.AVModeNotes: Only a Game Master user may change this setting, which will require Foundry VTT to reload.
WEBRTC.CaptureErrorAudio: Unable to capture from your Audio devices
WEBRTC.CaptureErrorAudioVideo: Unable to capture from your Audio & Video devices
WEBRTC.CaptureErrorVideo: Unable to capture from your Video devices
WEBRTC.CaptureWarningAudio: Unable to capture from your Video devices; Sharing Audio only
WEBRTC.CaptureWarningVideo: Unable to capture from your Audio devices; Sharing Video only
WEBRTC.ClientSettings.FIELDS.audioSink.h: Select which audio output device you wish to use.
WEBRTC.ClientSettings.FIELDS.audioSrc.hi: Select which audio capture device you wish to use, if any.
WEBRTC.ClientSettings.FIELDS.videoSrc.hi: Select which video capture device you wish to use, if any.
Choose how your voice is broadcast in AV calls.
WEBRTC.ConnectError: Error connection to Audio/Video Signalling Server
WEBRTC.ConnectionLostWarning: Lost connection to the Audio/Video Signalling server. Trying to re-establish connection.
WEBRTC.DeviceUnavailableWarning: Audio/Video communication was unable to start because one of the configured input devices was unavailable.
WEBRTC.GeneralTabNotGM: General Audio/Video Conferencing Settings can only be modified by the GM
WEBRTC.MenuHint: Configure settings specific to the integrated Audio/Video WebRTC component.
WEBRTC.NoSSLError: You cannot use Audio/Video calls unless your Foundry VTT server is using SSL certificates. See the online documentation for instructions.
WEBRTC.PTTKeyWarn: Your Push-to-Talk key is using an old value and may not work as expected: please reconfigure it.
WEBRTC.Title: Audio/Video Configuration
WEBRTC.WarningCannotEnableAudio: You cannot enable your microphone because you do not have permission to broadcast your audio feed.
WEBRTC.WarningCannotEnableVideo: You cannot enable your camera because you do not have permission to broadcast your video feed.
